item.title: SDS and Risk and Capacity
item.description:
SDS and Risk and Capacity: Key Learning Points

  • Supported decision making is key to ensuring people with impaired capacity can have as much choice and control over their support as possible while keeping safe.
  • Bringing in advocacy at the start helps to ensure people are not assessed as lacking capacity to make any decisions. SDS and Capacity Checklist for Frontline Staff
  • Frontline social workers need access to tools to help them explain SDS and assess for capacity in relation to the four SDS options.
    • Pick ‘n’ Mix
    • Accessible Information Guide to Direct Payment
    • Accessible Information Guide to Individual Service Fund (two way contract)
    • Accessible Information Guide to Individual Service Fund (three way contract)
    • Accessible Information Guide to Council Managed Service
    • SDS and Capacity Checklist for Frontline Staff
  • A level of choice and control is only possible if people understand what SDS is and how the assessment, planning and review processes work. SDS Mapping Tool
  • Good SDS support planning and risk enablement should seek to involve the person in planning for what could go wrong and how they will deal with the problem and manage the risks. Revised risk enablement support plan
  • Joint learning and development on SDS and risk and capacity designed and delivered by SDS and adult protection managers can give participants skills and confidence in the area of risk enablement in SDS. Learning and development course outline on SDS and risk and capacity
  • Local support for personal assistants can mitigate risks to these workers and the people they support. Personal Assistant Project

item.title: SDS and Capacity Checklist for Frontline Staff
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The SDS and Capacity Checklist is for frontline staff carrying out SDS assessments.
What does it do? 

The SDS and Capacity Checklist for Frontline Staff provides a four step guide and links to relevant resources for assessing for capacity in relation to understanding the four SDS options.

How can you use it? 
The SDS and Capacity Checklist for Frontline Staff is designed to be printed on card and folded in concertina fashion so that it can be carried in a frontline worker’s purse or wallet. You can add the contact details for your local advocacy service.

item.title: Revised Risk Enablement Support Plan
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The Revised Risk Enablement Support Plan is for SDS Leads in local authorities and provider organisations.
What does it do? 

The Revised Risk Enablement Support Plan is an example of how one local authority (Scottish Borders Council) co-designed the risk section of their SDS support plan to make it more accessible and risk enabling.

How can you use it? 
The Revised Risk Enablement Support Plan can be used as an example for SDS support plan redesign to facilitate risk enablement.

item.title: SDS and risk and capacity
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The learning and development course outline on SDS and risk and capacity is for SDS leads, adult protection leads, and learning and development professionals.
What does it do? 

The learning and development course outline is a design brief for joint learning and development on SDS and risk and capacity.

How can you use it? 
The learning and development course outline can be used as a set of recommendations for how a local authority could design and deliver learning and development for practitioners and others.
